title: 12 Building Blocks for the Perfect Winter Capsule Wardrobe
description: Apologies, but puffer coats didn’t make the cut.
excerpt: Apologies, but puffer coats didn’t make the cut.
text: Getting dressed is hard enough on an ideal day, but add frigid temps and icy conditions into the mix, and I’m constantly on the verge of canceling my plans to stay in bed all day. As a fashion editor, one thing that I’ve found immensely helpful in this struggle is having a winter capsule wardrobe, replete with versatile staples that lend themselves to mixing and matching. It really takes the guess work out of my mornings. In case you can relate, I’ve decided to share my winning formula here. To maintain style while staying warm, you’ll need foundational pieces like a good coat and boots, plus a few winter accessories and, of course, a healthy dose of shearling. Below, find 12 key building blocks for all your wintery outfits and shoppable options that transcend trends. Good luck out there, friends. The Wool Coat Out of all the available outerwear options, I’ve decided that a wool coat is the first and foremost necessity. Every winter, I’m reminded of the importance of stylish jackets that can make or break my cold-weather ensembles. One of these will keep you warm, and if you shop smart, it will last for years. Apiece Apart Matta Oversized CoatToteme Embroidered Wool-Blend Scarf CoatAcne Studios Double-Breasted Wool-Blend CoatEverlane The Cocoon Coat Now 30% OffMadewell Oversized Double-Breasted TopcoatNow 13% OffA.L.C. Winston JacketLeather PantsAs a self-diagnosed leather pants stan, I might be biased here, but I believe in my heart of hearts that everyone needs a pair. They are especially good for winter, as they block out the wind better than denim and other fabrics. I wear mine to work, on nights out, and everything in between. While black is the most versatile choice, I’ve been eyeing a metallic silver pair to add to my closet. AGOLDE Recycled Leather Fitted ’90sPistola Taylor Barrel Leg Faux Leather PantsWilfred The Melina Pant Now 80% OffVeronica Beard Beverly Vegan Leather Skinny-Flare PantKhaite Lenn PantAya Muse Tolobu Faux-Leather TrousersSturdy Boots The entrance to my high school was a long, uphill ramp, and I have many embarrassing memories of near or total wipeouts. I shudder at the thought of walking on an icy sidewalk. So, as an adult, I’ve traded my boat shoes for lug sole boots—though they would not have been uniform compliant—that offer more traction. I recommend a weatherproof option that can withstand rain, snow, and ice. Gianvito Rossi Tenney Leather Chelsea BootsMarion Parke Elizabeth Knee High Platform Boot Givenchy Voyou Chelsea BootsChloé Phoenix Leather Ankle Boots Moncler Hevea Over the Knee BootMoon Boot Icon Quilted Boots The Turtleneck Turtlenecks are the hero of winter layering. Whether you’re bundling up before hitting the slopes, adding warmth under a sweatshirt, or shielding your skin from that scratchy sweater, your winter capsule needs at least one of these bad boys. Eterne Soft Jersey Fitted Turtleneck TopIntimissimi Modal Cashmere TopNegative Underwear Whipped TurtleneckM.M. LaFleur The Axam Layering TurtleneckWe The Free Good Stripe TurtleneckReformation Nell Knit TopA Cashmere Sweater I know cashmere can be costly, but it really is worth it. Plus, getting dressed for work during the colder months is so much easier when you have a trusted lineup of sweaters and knit tops. Loulou Studio Oversize Cashmere V-Neck Sweater Cos Chunky Pure Cashmere TurtleneckClub Monaco Off the Shoulder Cashmere SweaterGuest in Residence Stealth CardiganLands’ End Cashmere Johnny Collar SweaterThe Elder Statesman Jasper SweaterThe Long-Sleeve Dress A personal favorite, I confess! I adore a full-length, long-sleeve dress for the winter months. At a time when I can hardly be bothered to change out of pajamas, slipping into a dress can have a transformative effect. And there are so many delectable knit options to be had. Proenza Schouler White Label Jude Knit DressAlex Mill Alice Long Sleeve Knit DressAFRM Juniper Dress Staud Eiza Dress Reformation Nemy Knit Dress Mango Long Sleeve Wrap Shirtdress Now 40% OffLeather GlovesAny accessory that makes me feel like Cruella De Vil is a must-have in my book. Yes, leather gloves look extremely posh and cool, but they’re also highly functional. For one thing, leather blocks wind, as mentioned earlier. They are also better for mitigating static compared to knit gloves, and they allow for more grip if you’re behind the wheel. Overland Bellis Cashmere-Lined Leather GlovesLoro Piana Elide Shearling-Lined Leather GlovesGucci Horsebit leather glovesCarolina Amato Saddle Leather Gloves The Row Lorella leather glovesDior Saddle GlovesFurry OuterwearSpeaking of Cruella... Everyone has their own opinion on furs, faux or real. Regardless of where you stand, this is the one time of year when you can lean into this look. Lovers and Friends Wayne Faux Shearling CoatUrban Revivo Notched Collar Fur Jacket Lauren Ralph Lauren Shearling Nappa Nanushka Ried Faux Racka Fur VestNow 79% OffL’Agence Lizbeth Faux Fur JacketMax Mara Teddy Bear Coat Something Warm for Your Head Balaclavas, hoods, or ushankas—I’m not picky. Better yet, why not have a few options on hand? By avoiding them to steer clear of hat hair, you’re only hurting yourself. These make such a difference in staying warm. Ganni Off-White Cashmere Mix BalaclavaLucky Zone Faux-Fur Bucket HatCos Mohair BeanieFree People All For You Hooded ScarfDamson Madder HoodGigi Pip Lou Knit BeanieA Scarf Perhaps you noticed a hooded scarf in the last category, which leads me to our next staple: scarves. Be it a scarf coat or a homemade take on Lenny Kravitz’s giant wrap, your arsenal isn’t complete without one. Lanvin Fringed Scarf Acne Studios Narrow Wool Mohair ScarfNow 27% OffLunya Lofty Wool Whip Stitch ScarfMarni Green & Blue ScarfAmerican Vintage East Scarf Burberry Check Hooded Cashmere Fringe Scarf Good Socks Boring, maybe, but this category should not be overlooked. I fancy myself a sock sommelier, if you will, and below are my current top recommendations for pairs that are equally fabulous whether seen or unseen. Bombas Merino Cashmere Blend Rib Calf SocksFalke Cashmere & Wool-Blend Cozy SocksThe Elder Statesman Yosemite Ribbed Cashmere SocksComme Si The Merino Tube SockBrochu Walker The Ribbed Cashmere SocksPrada Cotton SocksThe Shearling Bag If you want to do après-ski correctly, you’ll need a bag with a touch of shearling. Options abound this time of year, so feel free to be selective. I’ve rounded up a few personal favorites here. But be warned: Petting your handbag in public may result in dirty looks. html:
Getting dressed is hard enough on an ideal day, but add frigid temps and icy conditions into the mix, and I’m constantly on the verge of canceling my plans to stay in bed all day. As a fashion editor, one thing that I’ve found immensely helpful in this struggle is having a winter capsule wardrobe, replete with versatile staples that lend themselves to mixing and matching. It really takes the guess work out of my mornings.

In case you can relate, I’ve decided to share my winning formula here. To maintain style while staying warm, you’ll need foundational pieces like a good coat and boots, plus a few winter accessories and, of course, a healthy dose of shearling. Below, find 12 key building blocks for all your wintery outfits and shoppable options that transcend trends. Good luck out there, friends.

The Wool Coat

Out of all the available outerwear options, I’ve decided that a wool coat is the first and foremost necessity. Every winter, I’m reminded of the importance of stylish jackets that can make or break my cold-weather ensembles. One of these will keep you warm, and if you shop smart, it will last for years.

Apiece Apart Matta Oversized Coat

Toteme Embroidered Wool-Blend Scarf Coat

Acne Studios Double-Breasted Wool-Blend Coat

Everlane The Cocoon Coat

Now 30% Off

Madewell Oversized Double-Breasted Topcoat

Now 13% Off

A.L.C. Winston Jacket

Leather Pants

As a self-diagnosed leather pants stan, I might be biased here, but I believe in my heart of hearts that everyone needs a pair. They are especially good for winter, as they block out the wind better than denim and other fabrics. I wear mine to work, on nights out, and everything in between. While black is the most versatile choice, I’ve been eyeing a metallic silver pair to add to my closet.

AGOLDE Recycled Leather Fitted ’90s

Pistola Taylor Barrel Leg Faux Leather Pants

Wilfred The Melina Pant

Now 80% Off

Veronica Beard Beverly Vegan Leather Skinny-Flare Pant

Khaite Lenn Pant

Aya Muse Tolobu Faux-Leather Trousers

Sturdy Boots

The entrance to my high school was a long, uphill ramp, and I have many embarrassing memories of near or total wipeouts. I shudder at the thought of walking on an icy sidewalk. So, as an adult, I’ve traded my boat shoes for lug sole boots—though they would not have been uniform compliant—that offer more traction. I recommend a weatherproof option that can withstand rain, snow, and ice.

Gianvito Rossi Tenney Leather Chelsea Boots

Marion Parke Elizabeth Knee High Platform Boot

Givenchy Voyou Chelsea Boots

Chloé Phoenix Leather Ankle Boots

Moncler Hevea Over the Knee Boot

Moon Boot Icon Quilted Boots

The Turtleneck

Turtlenecks are the hero of winter layering. Whether you’re bundling up before hitting the slopes, adding warmth under a sweatshirt, or shielding your skin from that scratchy sweater, your winter capsule needs at least one of these bad boys.

Eterne Soft Jersey Fitted Turtleneck Top

Intimissimi Modal Cashmere Top

Negative Underwear Whipped Turtleneck

M.M. LaFleur The Axam Layering Turtleneck

We The Free Good Stripe Turtleneck

Reformation Nell Knit Top

A Cashmere Sweater

I know cashmere can be costly, but it really is worth it. Plus, getting dressed for work during the colder months is so much easier when you have a trusted lineup of sweaters and knit tops.

Loulou Studio Oversize Cashmere V-Neck Sweater

Cos Chunky Pure Cashmere Turtleneck

Club Monaco Off the Shoulder Cashmere Sweater

Guest in Residence Stealth Cardigan

Lands’ End Cashmere Johnny Collar Sweater

The Elder Statesman Jasper Sweater

The Long-Sleeve Dress

A personal favorite, I confess! I adore a full-length, long-sleeve dress for the winter months. At a time when I can hardly be bothered to change out of pajamas, slipping into a dress can have a transformative effect. And there are so many delectable knit options to be had.

Proenza Schouler White Label Jude Knit Dress

Alex Mill Alice Long Sleeve Knit Dress

AFRM Juniper Dress

Staud Eiza Dress

Reformation Nemy Knit Dress

Mango Long Sleeve Wrap Shirtdress

Now 40% Off

Leather Gloves

Any accessory that makes me feel like Cruella De Vil is a must-have in my book. Yes, leather gloves look extremely posh and cool, but they’re also highly functional. For one thing, leather blocks wind, as mentioned earlier. They are also better for mitigating static compared to knit gloves, and they allow for more grip if you’re behind the wheel.

Overland Bellis Cashmere-Lined Leather Gloves

Loro Piana Elide Shearling-Lined Leather Gloves

Gucci Horsebit leather gloves

Carolina Amato Saddle Leather Gloves

The Row Lorella leather gloves

Dior Saddle Gloves

Furry Outerwear

Speaking of Cruella... Everyone has their own opinion on furs, faux or real. Regardless of where you stand, this is the one time of year when you can lean into this look.

Lovers and Friends Wayne Faux Shearling Coat

Urban Revivo Notched Collar Fur Jacket

Lauren Ralph Lauren Shearling Nappa

Nanushka Ried Faux Racka Fur Vest

Now 79% Off

L’Agence Lizbeth Faux Fur Jacket

Max Mara Teddy Bear Coat

Something Warm for Your Head

Balaclavas, hoods, or ushankas—I’m not picky. Better yet, why not have a few options on hand? By avoiding them to steer clear of hat hair, you’re only hurting yourself. These make such a difference in staying warm.

Ganni Off-White Cashmere Mix Balaclava

Lucky Zone Faux-Fur Bucket Hat

Cos Mohair Beanie

Free People All For You Hooded Scarf

Damson Madder Hood

Gigi Pip Lou Knit Beanie

A Scarf

Perhaps you noticed a hooded scarf in the last category, which leads me to our next staple: scarves. Be it a scarf coat or a homemade take on Lenny Kravitz’s giant wrap, your arsenal isn’t complete without one.

Lanvin Fringed Scarf

Acne Studios Narrow Wool Mohair Scarf

Now 27% Off

Lunya Lofty Wool Whip Stitch Scarf

Marni Green & Blue Scarf

American Vintage East Scarf

Burberry Check Hooded Cashmere Fringe Scarf

Good Socks

Boring, maybe, but this category should not be overlooked. I fancy myself a sock sommelier, if you will, and below are my current top recommendations for pairs that are equally fabulous whether seen or unseen.

Bombas Merino Cashmere Blend Rib Calf Socks

Falke Cashmere & Wool-Blend Cozy Socks

The Elder Statesman Yosemite Ribbed Cashmere Socks

Comme Si The Merino Tube Sock

Brochu Walker The Ribbed Cashmere Socks

Prada Cotton Socks

The Shearling Bag

If you want to do après-ski correctly, you’ll need a bag with a touch of shearling. Options abound this time of year, so feel free to be selective. I’ve rounded up a few personal favorites here. But be warned: Petting your handbag in public may result in dirty looks.

Ferragamo Hug Bag

LAMARQUE Zoey Tote

Apparis Esti Faux Fur Tote Bag

Jacquemus Le Petit Bambimou Doux Shoulder Bag

Bottega Veneta Reversible Oversized Shearling Tote Bag

Prada Shearling Shoulder Bag

Why Trust ELLE

Every product featured on ELLE.com is independently researched, tested, or editor-approved. We only recommend products that we stand behind, and the merchandise featured on our site is always driven by editorial and product testing standards, not by affiliate deals or advertising relationships. Any content created in partnership with advertisers is marked as such.
